name: My Tangy German Potato Salad
author: Momma Lisa
summary: I really like this creamier version of the German potato salad and I like it warm or cold. Keeps well and is better the next day. This is an altered version of the traditional German potato salad.
ingredients: 12  red potatoes, each cut into 6 pieces
½ cup chopped bacon ends, visible fat trimmed
directions: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with water; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until pierced easily with a fork, about 10 minutes
Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Drain and transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to cool
Stir white vinegar, cider vinegar, sugar, salt, and black pepper together in the same skillet; bring to a boil and remove from heat to cool completely
Whisk sour cream and mayonnaise into cooled vinegar mixture until dressing is thick and creamy
Mix potatoes, dressing, onion, parsley, and chives together in a bowl
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 2 hours
Stir bacon into potato salad just before serving
